page.title: 01THE WALL & DISTRICT AREA
page.content: The area is largely rural and consequently sparsely populated. There are no major settlements, only small hamlets, the village of Wall, as well as a number of separate farmsteads. However, the north east corner of the district includes part of Lichfield and this provides some residential and industrial development. Agriculture is still a major form of employment but many residents commute to nearby urban centres such as Lichfield and the Birmingham and Black Country conurbation. Wall is a tourist attraction as the village covers the Roman town of Letocetum. On view is the excavated bath house of a Roman posting station and there is also a museum. Other historical buildings include Aldershawe Hall, Manor Farm and St. John the Baptist's Church.
